body: in previous php versions this resulted in the constructor to create a NULL formatter. Needs to be fixed.

issue.title: IntlException: Constructor failed [HumHub 1.0.1]

repository.name: humhub
repository.description: HumHub is an Open Source Enterprise Social Network. Easy to install, intuitive to use and extendable with countless freely available modules.

issue.body:
1. User profile > Language > select "Russian" > Save
2. Go to AdminCP, error:

![screenshot-2016-05-18-01-04-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12877339/15340916/9d1471ee-1c94-11e6-9b3d-524cffa95811.png)
1. User profile > Language > select "English" > Save
2. Go to AdminCP... NO error! :)

issue.title: Intl extension + Formatter + PHP7 = IntlException.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
I'm developing an application in yii 2.0.6 in an other than english language. Yii core messsages were translated correctly but I noticed dates weren't being formatted accordingly `/yii::$app->formatter->asDatetime($model->created_at);`. As per documentation I uncommented ;extension=php_intl.dll in php.ini file. Immediatly afterwards, I'm getting `IntlException  Constructor failed`. Migrated to yii 2.0.8 with no difference. Commenting back Intl extension reverts the issue.
### Additional info

| Q | A |
| --- | --- |
| Yii version | 2.0.8 |
| PHP version | 7.0.* |
| Operating system | XAMMP-win |

body: Looks like HHVM also has a different implementation... :-/

issue.title: Error local message parse error

repository.name: yii2-password
repository.description: Useful password strength validation utilities for Yii Framework 2.0

issue.body:
I found an issue only when I'd deployed to prod.
RU translation:
kvpwdstrength.php:21
Does not work:
{n, plural, =1{   } one{ # } few{ # } many{ # } other{ # }}
Works:
{n, plural, one{ # } few{ # } many{ # } other{ # }}

I think this is because of the equelnace of "=1" and "one".
